instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Measure PP3v3_S5 anywhere on the board in diode mode and I get 0.000. :/

I can't turn this board and see what gets hot, as I don't have the rest of the chassis, is there a way to calculate where the short could be?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
So I built a little harness that works on my PSU.

Can see 11.40v hitting the board but it goes nowhere as PP3v3_S5 has a dead short, it even has continuity to ground. :D

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: So what do we do to a shorted rails to find a short?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Inject power!

Except I did that already and nothing heated up, that I could see anyway.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
You could be unlucky and the short is INSIDE the board.

How much power did you put through the shorted rail ?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: How much current was going in? Also did you put 11V on the 3V3 rail?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
No, I didn't put 11v on a 3v rail, that sentence was worded poorly.

Picked up a new PSU as the other is really old. This one beeps and cuts out at 0.5v as if I'm shorting the terminals.


Edit: Buying a new desktop Power Supply. Seems the ones I have access too are rubbish.
Will report back once it arrives.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Start injecting low voltage.
Read the current and put more voltage, maintaining current bellow power supply limit.
If your supply is 5A max, injecting directly 3-5V can get it bloked if that means more than 5A.
In such case, cheaper power supplies do not inject anything and also do not advise you that.
Maybe you get 5A at 2V only.
Then you cannot inject more voltage, as the suplly will be blocked for current limit; even if that rail accept until 5V.
Is better to use 10A limit power supply; this will allow you to inject more voltage.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Took y our advice and bought a 10A supply.
Found the short in under a minute.


So now I get a green LED and nothing else. Shorting SMC_ONOFF_L does not get the fan to spin.

Not being familiar with iMacs I don't know if I can turn it on with no screen, button etc attached; so should it be turning on when shorting SMC_ONOFF_L at C600?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: Where was the short? No screen needed.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23703"]Where was the short? No screen needed. [/QUOTE]

C9480 was glowing when I put about 3amps through it at about 0.9 volts.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: C9480 is on 3V3_S4, how would that cause a short on 3V3_s5?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
No Title

[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23710"]C9480 is on 3V3_S4, how would that cause a short on 3V3_s5?[/QUOTE]

It's definitely 3v3_S5 on my screen.

threads.message: Maybe look at diagram?

threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 23760"]Maybe look at diagram?[/QUOTE]

Look at what diagram?

It clearly says PP3v3_S5....

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: I only see a board view......

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: Yes, showing you the power rail on the right hand side.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: Really???? How about opening the diagram PDF and looking at that......

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Ha! You're actually right.
How can the Boardview say one thing and the diagram say another....

Either way, the short on PP3v3_S5 went way when I replaced that cap.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message: S4 and S5 are shorted together then? U7900 fucked?

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Off to investigate!

Thanks for the lead.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
If I put power on C7901, U7900 just about blows smoke.

What is SLG5AP439 though, I can't find the chip anywhere.

threads.title: 820-3302 - Short on PP3v3_S5
threads.message:
Dunno, get a donor board, it is only used on 3302 and 3588.

I don't have 3482 diagram but it may be on there too.
